intro: Desmodium triflorum var. minimus, commonly known as the small-flowered velvet bean, is a perennial legume native to tropical and subtropical regions. It features trifoliate leaves with small, oval leaflets and produces small, yellowish-white flowers clustered in umbels. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it a velvety texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or disturbed areas. This species is valued for its nitrogen-fixing ability and use in forage and soil enrichment.
